A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"MNNG9920","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"MNNG9920 - Spontaneous Combustion and Reactive Ground","description":"

Spontaneous combustion is considered one of the core risks in underground coal mines. Similarly reactive ground provides a similar risk to Underground metalliferous mines. Ventilation control forms a significant part of the management plans to control these hazards. Significant incidents have occurred in Australia and overseas that had the potential to cause loss of life. This course will address the causes, incidents and controls required to manage this hazard.  Additionally, case studies and spontaneous management plans will be reviewed.

Consultation in the 4th session","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"2d4fe93fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961904","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"694fe93fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961907","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO5","cl_id":"a54fe93fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a96190a","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"e94fa93fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619f2","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"ed4fe93fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a961901","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"154fa93fdbfd1c50eb6b147a3a9619e9","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Spontaneous combustion management","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"75","description":"

A comprehensive report of risk factors, detection and analysis methods and management processes and systems that are currently used in the control of spontaneous combustion and reactive ground. This report should also contain a comprehensive critical analysis of the management plan that is in place at the participant's site.Feedback will be provided via consultation with mining engineering staff and via a generic feedback statement that covers the deficiencies and strengths of the reports handed in. a tailored feedback section will also be included so that the individual will receive specific comments

contentlets.description: Spontaneous combustion is considered one of the core risks in underground coal mines. Similarly reactive ground provides a similar risk to Underground metalliferous mines. Ventilation control forms a significant part of the management plans to control these hazards. Significant incidents have occurred in Australia and overseas that had the potential to cause loss of life. This course will address the causes, incidents and controls required to manage this hazard.  Additionally, case studies and spontaneous management plans will be reviewed.
contentlets.title: Spontaneous Combustion and Reactive Ground

Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"MNNG9921","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"MNNG9921 - Mine Ventilation Legislation","description":"

Explosions, disasters accidents and incidents have been an unfortunate part of working life. These events invariably led to changes in legislation. By studying the past disasters participants will be better equipped to prevent their re-occurrence. Current legislation will be studied in this context rather than just studying the statutes. Also the historical reasons for the establishment of limits, will allow the participants the opportunity to explain the significance of legislative compliance.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"93a0993fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a961970","name":"Fully online - Intensive"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Assessment","assessment_type":{"label":"Report","value":"report"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"100","description":"

Each participant will be given a case study to analyse. A detailed report will be required that will include amongst other things a detailed evaluation of the relevant legislation that was in force at the time of the incident, the changes in legislation that were a direct result of the incident, an evaluation of the existing legislation in its ability to prevent a re- occurrence.

\n

Feedback will be provided via consultation with mining engineering staff and via a generic feedback statement that covers the deficiencies and strengths of the reports handed in. a tailored feedback section will also be included so that the individual will receive specific comments

contentlets.description: Explosions, disasters accidents and incidents have been an unfortunate part of working life. These events invariably led to changes in legislation. By studying the past disasters participants will be better equipped to prevent their re-occurrence. Current legislation will be studied in this context rather than just studying the statutes. Also the historical reasons for the establishment of limits, will allow the participants the opportunity to explain the significance of legislative compliance.
contentlets.title: Mine Ventilation Legislation

A level of study that leads to the award of a Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma, Masters Degree or Doctorate.","campus":"Sydney","study_level_single":{"label":"Postgraduate","value":"pgrd"},"code":"MNNG9922","attributes":[],"credit_points_header":"6 Units of Credit","eqivalents":[],"exclusion":[],"search_title":"MNNG9922 - Mine Ventilation Practices","description":"

Mine Ventilation Practice details the techniques and processes required to put ventilation theory to effective use in an underground mine. Examples of world's best practice will be discussed and reviewed. Techniques used by coal mines will be explored as to their applicability to hard rock mines and vice versa. Through directed learning participants will design a ventilation system for a mine.

","hb_assessments":[{"delivery_variation":{"cl_id":"66a0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619e1","name":"Fully online - Intensive"},"assessments":[{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Coal mine ventilation circuit design","assessment_type":{"label":"Project","value":"project"},"assessment_id":"1","weighting":"50","description":"

Participants will be given a structured description of a coal mine and will produce a report that provides a detailed design for the ventilation of the mine

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"2ea0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619da","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"6aa0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619dd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"92a0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619d5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"eea0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619d7","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"92a0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619c7","links":[]},{"individual":{"label":null,"value":null},"assessment_name":"Metalliferous mine ventilation circuit design","assessment_type":{"label":"Project","value":"project"},"assessment_id":"2","weighting":"50","description":"

Participants will be given a structured description of a metalliferous mine and will produce a report that provides a detailed design for the ventilation of the mine

\n

Feedback will be provided via consultation with mining engineering staff and via a generic feedback statement that covers the deficiencies and strengths of the reports handed in. a tailored feedback section will also be included so that the individual will receive specific comments

","learning_outcomes":[{"value":"CLO3","cl_id":"2ea0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619da","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO4","cl_id":"6aa0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619dd","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO1","cl_id":"92a0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619d5","key":"code"},{"value":"CLO2","cl_id":"eea0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619d7","key":"code"}],"delivery_variations":[],"applies_to_all_delivery_variations":"true","cl_id":"daa0593fdbb91c50eb6b147a3a9619cb","links":[]}]}],"inactive_course_alert":null,"timetableURL":"http://timetable.unsw.edu.au/2021/MNNG9922.html","subject_sample_text_staticcontent":"To access course outline, please visit:","links":[]}
contentlets.description: Mine Ventilation Practice details the techniques and processes required to put ventilation theory to effective use in an underground mine. Examples of world's best practice will be discussed and reviewed. Techniques used by coal mines will be explored as to their applicability to hard rock mines and vice versa. Through directed learning participants will design a ventilation system for a mine.
contentlets.title: Mine Ventilation Practices
